channel.title: Pycon on PyCon Pune Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Pycon on PyCon Pune Blog

item.title: PyCon Pune 2018 cancelled
item.description: PyCon Pune 2018 started with a huge enthusiasm and to make the event much bigger and better than 2017. The preparations for the event was in full swing until we hit the biggest blocker to continue the event - money. The event is primarily dependent on ticket sales and sponsorships. As on date, we have received sponsorships from the following organizations: - Python Software Foundation - Red Hat - Travis CI

item.title: Welcome Brett Cannon, Our First Keynote Speaker
item.description: PyCon Pune 2018 is thrilled to welcome Brett Cannon, our first keynote speaker. “Came for the language and stayed for the community” - our motto is the quote that actually originated the idea of having PyCon Pune. The lines which was used in two different Python Conferences of India in 2017. Therefore apart from Python, the love for this quote is also binding the Python Community in India. Now is the our chance to meet the person behind that thought, in PyCon Pune 2018.

item.title: The Registration for the PyCon Pune 2018 is now open.
item.description: PyCon Pune, the conference that started its journey in 2017, has opened up the registrations for the 2018 version now. You have the following ticket options for the conference which you can purchase from the registration page in our website: The Conference Ticket for ₹1700 grants you access to the main conference, 8th & 9th of February 2018. This ticket also includes a t-shirt of your preferred size. The Conference & Developer Sprints Ticket come at a price of ₹2500.
